resources.string: Check the current version and legal information
Where would you like to browse your image from?
Select a Linux image from the list below to start creating a LoD container.
Something went wrong an a LoD container cannot be created. Please try again.
Are you sure you want to shutdown your container?
Controls maximum number of Big cores available to your Linux container
Controls maximum number of Little cores available to your Linux container

"Deleting a Linux image completely removes it from your device.
Unmounting a Linux image removes it from your LoD container list. You can still access this file."
"There's insufficient storage. Delete files you no longer need and try again."
Please check your Wi-Fi settings to resume the download. Either your Wi-Fi connection is weak or your mobile data has reached its limit.
Tap the button to unzip your file. Once unzipped, open the Linux on DeX app again, browse for your image and create a container with it.
You can still use Linux on DeX or any other application on your phone while your image is being downloaded.
Click on the fields below to edit text.
All the fields below are editable. Simply click on one of the fields you want to adjust.

"Please provide us with a detailed description of your request.
Please fill out the template as seen below. Summary: Description: Attachments (Screenshot): Environment (Device & Peripheral information): Reproducible (Yes/No/Sometimes): Priority (1-Critical, 2-Major, 3-Minor, 4-feature request):
Thank you for providing feedback to better improve our services."

"Your system log will be sent to Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd for analysis. Your system log may include information such as the version of Android you currently using and the build information of your phone. The system log data will only be used to analyze the problem and improve the application.
"Standard data rates apply. It is recommended that you connect to Wi-Fi when sending the log file to avoid charges.
Send Linux on DeX log data?

"We've found an existing file or folder named %s in the Internal storage.
%s path is used exclusively for Linux on DeX.
Are you sure you want to continue using the file or folder?"
If you cancel, the selected Linux image will be unmounted and no changes will be saved.
This Linux image has been moved, renamed or deleted. Try browsing for it to retrieve your work and information.

"This Linux image is already in use by another LoD container.
Please select another image."
You are able to download a large image. We recommend using Wi-Fi only and avoid mobile data usage charges and potential delays.
"Give your image a name. Description field is optional."

"This Linux image has been moved, renamed or deleted. A new LoD container could not be created.
Browse for a valid image to create a LoD container."
Controls the size Linux roots can grow to within your device storage.

"The performance of your container will depend on your SD card.
SD card is out of the secured path: "/Internal storage/LoD"
We recommend moving your file to the secured path using My Files app and then create a LoD container."
"This Linux image is not in the right format. Please select another image."
A LoD container could not be created. Delete files you no longer need and try again.
Your LoD container could not be edited. Delete files you no longer need and try again.
Invalid value. Please select a value in between 1stGB and 2ndGB.
I have read and agree to all of the above
"A new Linux image is available. Visit www.linuxondex.com to get the step by step guide and update your current Linux image."
Controls maximum amount of memory used by your Linux container
Linux on DeX may slow down.
Linux on DeX may suddenly shutdown.
Please save your data and close other apps.
Please close the application using the DeX task bar, then restart it again.
There is no more memory available
Your LoD container needs a name
Your containers will be shown here.
Your container details will be shown here.

"The image you are trying to use is out of the secured path: "/Internal storage/LoD"
Please move your file to the secured path using My Files app and try again."
Your device is not supported. Please visit www.linuxondex.com for more details.

"Something went wrong and a LoD container could not be created.
Please close Linux on DeX and try again."

"Something went wrong and a LoD container could not be edited.
Please close Linux on DeX and try again."
Unable to open %s. Tap SETTINGS, go to Application info > Permissions, then allow the following permissions and try again:
Sign in to your Samsung account
This Linux image is not initialized. click OK will do rebase/install process
This Linux image is not initialized

"We've found an existing file or folder named %s in the Internal storage. Please go to My Files, rename it and restart Linux on DeX.
%s path is used exclusively for Linux on DeX."
Your Samsung account has been deleted. Sign back in to continue experiencing the Linux on DeX experience.
Linux on DeX is optimized for Samsung DeX. Open the app on a Samsung DeX screen and run your LoD container.
"Cannot run this LoD container. Close the Linux on DeX app and try again."
"Your device is currently signed out from Samsung account. Sign in to your Samsung account to enjoy the Linux on DeX experience."
I have read and agree to all items and conditions above.

"PLEASE NOTE THAT THIS IS A BETA VERSION OF THE LINUX ON DEX WHICH IS STILL UNDERGOING FINAL TESTING BEFORE ITS OFFICIAL COMMERCIAL RELEASE. DUE TO TECHNICAL, LEGAL OR BUSINESS CONSIDERATIONS OF THIRD PARTY SERVICE PROVIDERS AND LICENSORS, OR FOR ANY OTHER REASON, LINUX ON DEX MAY END SERVICE AT ANY TIME WITHOUT PRIOR NOTIFICATION TO YOU.
Please use only the authorized image provided directly through Linux on DeX. Other versions or unauthorized images may not operate properly.
Linux on DeX currently supports customized Ubuntu image (Ubuntu 16.04 LTS version provided by Canonical) which only operates on select Samsung devices. Please visit ["www.linuxondex.com"] for the full list of compatible Samsung devices. "

" To operate properly, packages (apps and programs) must be built for ARM 64-bit and must comply with Android security policy ("https://source.android.com/security/selinux/").
If you have already consented to the collection of diagnostic and usage data, Linux on DeX will accordingly collect such data to improve the quality and performance of the services. You can disable this in your device Settings [Settings>General management>Report diagnostic info to Samsung].
Linux on DeX may slow down or suddenly be turned off in case of lack of memory. At least 15GB ROM and 4GB RAM is required in your device for downloading a Linux image. Additional storage may be required when installing additional packages (apps and programs).
LINUX ON DEX IS PROVIDED AS IS, WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL SAMSUNG BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, INCLUDING WITHOUT LIMITATION, ANY DAMAGE TO COMPUTER SYSTEMS, HARDWARE OR SOFTWARE, LOSS OF DATA, OR ANY OTHER PERFORMANCE FAILURES, ANY ERRORS, BUGS, VIRUSES OR OTHER DEFECTS ARISING FROM, OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE LINUX ON DEX OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS THEREOF. "
Sign in to your Samsung account and get ready to enjoy the Linux on DeX experience.
A Samsung account lets you enjoy the Linux on DeX experience.
Sign in to your Samsung account
Save your changes, or they will not take effect.
Share files with the Android file system on your device. LoD_Share folder will be created.
"KEY_NAME Space : Control-@ (NUL) KEY_NAME A..Z : Control-A..Z KEY_NAME 5 : Control-] KEY_NAME 6 : Control-^ KEY_NAME 7 : Control-_ KEY_NAME 9 : F11 KEY_NAME 0 : F12"

"KEY_NAME 1..9 : F1-F9 KEY_NAME 0 : F10 KEY_NAME W : Up KEY_NAME A : Left KEY_NAME S : Down KEY_NAME D : Right KEY_NAME P : PageUp KEY_NAME N : PageDown KEY_NAME T : Tab KEY_NAME L : | (pipe) KEY_NAME U : _ (underscore) KEY_NAME E : Control-[ (ESC) KEY_NAME X : Delete KEY_NAME I : Insert KEY_NAME H : Home KEY_NAME F : End KEY_NAME . : Control-\\ "
Your LoD container needs a size
"Click on the and choose an image by browsing it from your device or download one from our server."
Now that your image is mounted you can start setting up your container. Choose how big the Linux roots can grow.
Connect your phone to an external display see the full GUI of your containers or simply work on the go on terminal mode directly from your phone.
Give your LoD container a name and decide whether to share folders with the Android system on your device.
Choose when to run, edit, or delete your LoD container.
Avoid frustrating shutdown results and slow down with Linux on DeX.

"Something went wrong.
Please close Linux on DeX and try again."

"Something went wrong and a LoD container could not be created.
Please close Linux on DeX and try again."
Linux on DeX has paused. Simply open the app to resume.

"Linux on DeX has paused. Connect to an external display to resume.
If you close the app, your unsaved data will be lost."
"Connect to an external display to resume app. If you close the app, your unsaved data will be lost."
This Linux image will be unmounted and you will be able to upload a new image.
The current version of Linux on DeX is invalid. Please update the app and try again.
Linux on DeX requires your device to have the latest software to support some features.
Visit our server and download one of our recommended images.
